comments:
Sample project is attached.

Steps to reproduce:
-------------------------
- from windows Explore, copy attached project into workspace
- Import it as an existing project, during the importing, should see an error 
message pop up and the error log generated.

Created an attachment (id=18805)
it's a cdt 2.0 project used to reproduced the problem
Hi James,

Are you able to reproduce the problem?  I have tried a couple of times with the 
attached project and cannot reproduce.  Do you have automatic building set on 
and/or indexing set on for the project?

Project conversion can be tricky because a build or the indexer can be running 
in another thread and asking for information from the project while the 
conversion is taking place.  I thought that I got this straightened out in CDT 
2.1.1, but I could have missed a case, or changes to the indexer could have re-
triggered the problem.  I haven't yet changed the MBS in the 3.0 stream, but 
some changes have been made to the scanner info discovery mechanism.
(In reply to comment #2)
> Hi James,
> Are you able to reproduce the problem?  I have tried a couple of times with 
the 
> attached project and cannot reproduce.  Do you have automatic building set 
on 
> and/or indexing set on for the project?
> Project conversion can be tricky because a build or the indexer can be 
running 
> in another thread and asking for information from the project while the 
> conversion is taking place.  I thought that I got this straightened out in 
CDT 
> 2.1.1, but I could have missed a case, or changes to the indexer could have 
re-
> triggered the problem.  I haven't yet changed the MBS in the 3.0 stream, but 
> some changes have been made to the scanner info discovery mechanism.


Yes it is reproducable ... just not always.  It is a race condition 8-(

The problem is that we are converting the project(removing/creating
a .cdtbuild file) while the project is being imported.  So:
- the indexer is trigger by the import in a job
- ask for info: calls loadBuildInfo()
- in loadBuildInfo the project will be converted.
- meanwhile another thread/Job comes in and the loadbuildInfo fails
  with NPE, because we fail to find a ".cdtbuild",(we just remove it
  with the convertion).

We should not do this in broadcasting event Change, because
the Workspace is locked.  Below is a better stackTrace of the problem.

So how about 
- delaying the convertion .. if the workspace is lock.  Return nothing
- make the convertion a schedule Job
- Then trigger a pathEntry change again to notify the Indexer and
  the rest of the CDT Model.

I'll be happy to take a stab at it, if you like.

Hi Alain,

> So how about 
> - delaying the convertion .. if the workspace is lock.  Return nothing
> - make the convertion a schedule Job
> - Then trigger a pathEntry change again to notify the Indexer and
>  the rest of the CDT Model.
>
> I'll be happy to take a stab at it, if you like.

Yes, please do.  My only concern regarding delaying the conversion is whether 
we could get into other race condiions with the user.  That is, if the 
conversion is running in the background and the user performs UI actions that 
require information from the project buildinfo.  As long as the user is forced 
to wait until the conversion has completed, then I think it will be OK.

Thanks,
Leo
*** Bug 88121 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Ouf!!
Problems:
 - Change where done in the workspace by the UpdateManager
   while the workspace was lock. For example when
 ManagedBuildManager.loadBuildInfo(IProject)
   was call inside a ResourceDelta event.

 - IFile(.cdtbuild) may not exist yet, this is because in Eclipse-3.1
   when importing the refresh is done in a background job.

Proposed solutions:
- Change the UpdateManager class to use java.io.File
  instead of IFile.
- When the workspace tree is lock delay the saving in bacground job.
> Yes, please do.  My only concern regarding delaying the conversion is 
whether 
> we could get into other race condiions with the user.

Noted.

The conversion was not delayed, we still do it but not via IFile
but rather via java.io.File.  But the saving
ManagedBuildManager.saveBuildInfo(...) however is delayed
if the workspace is lock, this should not affect things to much
since the ManagedBuildInfo is cache and clients will have the correct
info
Fix in the head.

James can you verify when you have a chance.

Thanks

Note, you may still stumble to a race condition, within a UI
but this will be a very rare case and it's not a regression, it's always
been there

traces.message: The resource tree is  locked for modifications.
